name: Hyatt Union Square New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently spent 4 nights in one of their ADA king rooms. Based on ADA rooms at other hotels, I was hesitant to book one because, in my opinion, they typically aren't as nice as the other rooms in a hotel. At the Hyatt Union Square, we found their ADA rooms to be much nicer than others I have stayed in, and I would not hesitate to stay in one at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great location and hotel

reviews.text: There was a mix-up with our reservation that we found out about when we arrived. Our reservation for the last night of our stay was inadvertently cancelled by the Hyatt customer service rep, and we didn't know that until check-in. In addition, there were very few Hyatt rooms left in Manhattan for that night, so we were a little anxious about what we were going to do. The next day, William, the front-office manager straightened everything out and honored our previously booked rate at the Hyatt US for that last night, which was a big relief. Thanks, William!
reviews.title: Brand new hyatt, location is ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other positives:
reviews.title: Great Location and Excellent Staff

reviews.text: - The location of the hotel is great. It is a block south of Union Square and the US subway station with multiple lines. Plus, it is easy to walk to many destinations all over Manhattan from the hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: - There are tons of restaurants and bars to choose from in the area.
reviews.title: PERFECT

reviews.text: We chose the Hyatt for two specific criteria, the availability of 2 queen beds and the location.
reviews.title: When Is A Reservation NOT Really A Reservation

reviews.text: Our reservation was confirmed by phone and subsequent email.
reviews.title: No, thank you. Go elsewhere.
Great stay
reviews.text: We arrived at midnight and upon entering the lobby area it was as if we did not exist...no greeting, no acknowledgment, nada! When the twenty-something, newly minted NYU hotel management grad decided she would grace us by checking us in the first thing she tells us is we cant have the room we reserved because the guests extended their stay. Tough luck.
Then Mr Night Manager Could Care Less joins us and tells us we can have two rooms on the same floor. Oh Goodie, but our reservation was for a room with TWO QUEEN BEDS.
reviews.title: Great hotel near NYU

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bottom Line- This is a hotel with an arrogant, indifferent staff that makes the experience miserable. Stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Great location and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a really well located hotel, plum in the middle of the city. Bowery is a 10 min walk south. Meatpacking district is 15 mins west, Empire State 15 mins north and Brooklyn is an hours walk over the Williamsburg Bridge East. If you like walking and the sun is out, the views are great going over the bridge.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: We booked an Alcove Loft, as this was a lowest available rate. We were at the Andaz Wall Street, but decied to stay "uptown". Applied a Diamond Suite Upgrade to it, which caused confusion, as this is actually a suite, so no upgrade. Manager on duty explained it when questioned, so all sorted. Room is a decent size, well kitted out, though bathroom area a bit small.
reviews.title: Quick overnight to NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bar in the restaurant closes quite early. Hotel bar closes 130am ish without notice, which was weird.
reviews.title: Mostly Rewarding
Mixed bag
reviews.text: Would certainly come back next time we're in NY.

My daughter and I headed into the city for a quick visit. Needed a nice hotel with a good price in a central location. I normally stay in Midtown but love the union Square area so thought we would give the Hyatt a try. Brand new, great location just a block off Union Square and the subway station. Staff was wonderful, we arrived early and were given our room.
reviews.title: Uptown/Soho Chic in the Heartbeat of Manhattan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally a hotel in the Village has opened and the staff has done a stellar job launching the soft opening. Kudos! Perfect Spring weather and a happy occasion did not hurt either, but this new Hyatt stands for itself as a great place to spend a NYC weekend, to explore downtown or visit the kids at NYU. Front desk manager Cheryl Huse has assembled a fine cast, the rooms are NYC small but very smart, and the restaurant is first rate. The Fourth, which opened to Friends and Family only so far--is excellent: the beet salad and salmon were both delectable at dinner and coffee at breakfast makes my top ten list. Around the corner from the Strand, hovering at Union Square, this new Hyatt is a great lodging choice for NY downtown visits.
reviews.title: Terrific new hotel in the Village----fun, hip and classy!

reviews.text: I had a very pleasant stay. The staff were very friendly and accommodating throughout my stay. The room had modern decor and was at the same time both warm and inviting. The bedding was pristine and comfortable. The towels were soft. The courtyard view is not ideal for those looking for something memorable, but it is very quiet and serene! The gym was well equipped. I didn't get to try the restaurants, as they were not yet open. I can really say nothing unpleasant about my stay. I had a lovely visit!
reviews.title: Pleasant stay!

reviews.text: Avoid the tourist masses uptown and settle into a convenient location for your NYC activities. You feel like a VIP as the valet whisks away your car to a secure location. The young efficient staff quickly dispels any notion you may have had about unfriendly New Yorkers with smiles and a super quick check-in. This is Manhattan and space is at a premium for everyone. A "standard" room is on the small side but well designed with every important amenity. The rooms are spotless, comfortable and quiet. We are former long time New Yorkers and make this hotel our go-to spot for city visits.
reviews.title: A great NYC location and efficient comfort

reviews.text: . The hotel is within walking distance to Greenwich Village and comprehensive shopping is around the corner. Union Square Park is next door with a farmer's market, street musicians and landscaped strolling. A major subway station takes you to all of NY quickly and economically.
reviews.title: singl bar at the hyatt union square

reviews.text: We dropped into the bar called Singl in the Hyatt lobby, for a brief rest after walking from Battery Park. The waitress was very sweet, the washrooms were perfectly clean and the service excellent. The value for the wine was quite reasonable .
reviews.title: Just say no.

reviews.text: We recently made a 36 hr trip to NYC, travelled all day and arrived at the Hyatt, Union Square at midnight. At that time we were informed that the guests in the room we reserved ( to sleep 3) extended their stay. So sorry, you can go to another location uptown or we have 2 rooms available in different locations . Not only was this really disappointing news it was delivered with indifference, sneers and giggles. I all my years, I have never had this happen. The staff is extremely young and inexperienced. For the ensuing duration we stayed there, the check in staff and manager ignored us upon entering the hotel repeatedly. No eye contact, or "hey, Im really sorry about what happened"...nothing. I asked not to be charged for night #1, but a message left on my phone from the manager said they couldn't do that. I did receive a 50% comp for my stay, but in all sincereity, my family and I were extremely upset for the entire stay. Regarding the rooms... they are very small and very little walking space as the furniture in there is too large for the space. There was no where to put luggage, except on the floor by the door. No true closet and a reluctance from the housekeeping staff when I asked for a few extra towels. The beds are very hard and the mattresses very thin.Wow, all for $700/night. Unfortunately, it takes an awful experience to sit down and write this review. I have had some great stays all over the world since my last review, but didn't take the time to thank them on this forum. I apologize for that and I will do so. The really challenging thing in any industry is when things don't go as planned. True customer service is in how things are handled. I'm sure Mr or Mrs Hyatt would not approve.
reviews.title: New York hotel

reviews.text: The Hyatt in Union Square is in a great downtown location for a visit to NYC. It is a new hotel with high end linens, furniture and staff! The staff checking us in were very friendly and made the process go quickly and smoothly. The room was beautiful and squeaky clean. We were able to secure a good rate through booking.com; I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in the city.
reviews.title: Great Location

description: The brand new Hyatt Union Square New York offers 178 luxe guestrooms and suites that evoke the area’s vibrant spirit and invigorating atmosphere. Renowned interior designer Paul Vega created a unique urban space that blends high design with natural elements. Our building’s historic façade and expansive 23-foot high ceiling provide a grand entrance for your arrival, and our enthusiastic team will ensure that all your expectations are exceeded.
